meanings.definition: The enlargement of an organ or tissue caused by an increase in the reproduction rate of its cells.
meanings.sent1: The hyperplasia of the plant's leaves made them grow larger than usual.
meanings.sent2: Doctors observed hyperplasia in the patient's liver during the medical examination.
meanings.sent3: The hyperplasia of the balloons at the party made the room look festive.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was like hyperplasia, spreading and growing rapidly.
meanings.sent5: The hyperplasia of the city's population led to increased demand for housing.

meanings.definition: Abnormal increase in the number of normal cells in a tissue.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with hyperplasia after examining the tissue sample.
meanings.sent2: The hyperplasia in the skin cells caused a visible bump on the surface.
meanings.sent3: The hyperplasia of students in the library during exam week was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The hyperplasia of ideas in her mind sparked a creative explosion.
meanings.sent5: The hyperplasia of traffic in the city center created chaos during rush hour.
